quote: ''Finality is death. Perfection is finality. Nothing is perfect. There are lumps in it,'' said the Philosopher.
A perfect human being: Man in search of his ideal of perfection. Nothing less.
Action is the highest perfection and drawing forth of the utmost power, vigor, and activity of man's nature.
American women expect to find in their husbands a perfection that English women only hope to find in their butlers.
Artists who seek perfection in everything are those who cannot attain it in anything.
Be intent on the perfection of the present day.
Christianity is the highest perfection of humanity.
Confusion of goals and perfection of means seems, in my opinion, to characterize our age.
''Finality is death. Perfection is finality. Nothing is perfect. There are lumps in it,'' said the Philosopher.
A perfect human being: Man in search of his ideal of perfection. Nothing less.
Action is the highest perfection and drawing forth of the utmost power, vigor, and activity of man's nature.
American women expect to find in their husbands a perfection that English women only hope to find in their butlers.
Artists who seek perfection in everything are those who cannot attain it in anything.
Be intent on the perfection of the present day.
Christianity is the highest perfection of humanity.
Confusion of goals and perfection of means seems, in my opinion, to characterize our age.
Does the real thing ever have the perfection of a stage performance?
Don't waste your time striving for perfection, instead, strive for excellence - doing your best.
Enlightenment does not ask you to be perfect; it simply asks you to find perfection right where you stand.
Ethics is the activity of man directed to secure the inner perfection of his own personality.
Faultily faultless, icily regular, splendidly null, dead perfection; no more.
Fix your eyes on perfection and you make almost everything speed towards it.
I don't confuse greatness with perfection. To be great anyhow is…the higher achievement.
I hold that the perfection of form and beauty is contained in the sum of all men.
If a man should happen to reach perfection in this world, he would have to die immediately to enjoy himself.
It is through art, and through art only, that we can realise our perfection.
It seems that the creative faculty and the critical faculty cannot exist together in their highest perfection.
Measure not by the scale of perfection the meager product of reality.
No one ever approaches perfection except by stealth, and unknown to themselves.
Perfection has one grave defect. It is apt to be dull.
Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
Perfection is attained by slow degrees; she requires the hand of time.
Perfection is immutable. But for things imperfect, change is the way to perfect them.
Perfection is perfectly simple; fouling things up requires true skill.
Perfection is the child of time.
Perfection of means and confusion of goals seem - in my opinion - to characterize our age.
Philosophy is a kind of journey, ever learning yet never arriving at the ideal perfection of truth.
Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
So much perfection argues rottenness somewhere.
The artist who aims at perfection in everything achieves it in nothing.
The condition of perfection is idleness: the aim of perfection is youth.
The cruelest thing a man can do to a woman is to portray her as perfection.
The essence of being human is that one does not seek perfection.
The perfection of art is to conceal art.
The principal mark of genius is not perfection but originality, the opening of new frontiers.
The pursuit of perfection often impedes improvement.
The pursuit of perfection, then, is the pursuit of sweetness and light.
The true perfection of man lies not in what man has, but in what man is.
There is a danger of changing too much in the search for perfection.
This is the very perfection of a man, to find out his own imperfections.
To make one good action succeed another, is the perfection of goodness.
Trifles make perfection, but perfection is no trifle.
We all suffer from the preoccupation that there exists ... in the loved one, perfection.
We never taste happiness in perfection, our most fortunate successes are mixed with sadness.
When you aim for perfection, you discover it's a moving target.
Why do we discover faults so much more readily than perfection.
auther: Marie de Rabutin-Chantal marquise de  Sévigné
